author: kevaundray
content:
Yeah I don't have a strong opinion here after checking both approaches (If you change it to last blob, then also LGTM) -- I think it also makes more sense to encode the amount of padded data instead of the total size of the encoded data in both cases.

So for example, if the serialized payload is one byte `[8]` and blobs are four bytes.

Then the payload when encoded would look like `[2,8,0,0]`

The first number lets us know how many bytes we used for padding which is bounded by the `blob size - 2` so we know that the first digit will never be more than 2. 

If we use the total size of the payload then that is bounded by a lot of other external things that affect payload size
